Welcome

xylem is a command-line tool for installing system dependencies. For *end-users*, xylem helps you install system dependencies for software that you are building from source. For *developers*, xylem simplifies the problem of installing system dependencies on different platforms. Instead of having to figure out which debian package on Ubuntu Oneiric contains Boost, you can just specify a dependency on 'boost'. xylem is supported on a variety of platforms/package managers:

  • Ubuntu (apt)
  • Debian (apt)
  • OS X (Homebrew)
  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux (rpm/experimental)
  • Arch (pacman/experimental)
  • Gentoo (equery/experimental)
  • Cygwin (experimental)
